Geothermal power plant.Description: Geothermal power plants harness the heat from the Earth's core to generate electricity.
Heat exchangers are used in geothermal power plants to transfer heat from the geothermal fluid to the working fluid.
Steam turbines are used in geothermal power plants to convert the thermal energy of steam into mechanical energy.
Cooling towers are used in geothermal power plants to cool the working fluid before it is re-injected into the geothermal reservoir.
